transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: So, is it a British problem or an Indian problem? No, I think it is a British problem. First of all, because there is so much historical amnesia about what the empire really entailed. The fact that you don't really teach colonial history in your schools.

transcript.speaker: SPEAKER_00
transcript.text: Children doing A -levels in history don't learn a line of colonial history. There's no real awareness of the atrocities. The fact that Britain financed its industrial revolution and its prosperity from the depredations of empire. The fact that Britain came to one of the richest countries in the world in the early 18th century and reduced it after 200 years of plunder to one of the poorest countries.
